content: Thanks for the article, right on target!Arriving to a similar discovery 2 years ago, we started a community to leverage that principle: Crossmodalism We are creating bridges and spaces to exchange knowledge between disciplines. Effectively breaking the specialisation paradigm but also efficiently sorting out through information (it takes a lot less time to learn the key principles from an expert than from reading specialised books!). It is not enough to go through content from other fields. It is the different thought patterns that make the biggest difference: an artist thinks very different from an scientist, combining both logics on a single problem brings about an exponential number of applications.
